page.title: 08HOUSES AND HOUSING
page.content: Just over 40% of the houses in Youlgrave are detached; a similar percentage are semi-detached. Most houses are built of natural stone, usually local limestone. Houses are never built of red brick because the Peak Park Board won't allow it. 66% of homes have central heating and many have coal fires. 20% have double glazing but a lot of the older houses maintain tradition by keeping little square windows. 80% of the population live in a house and nearly 75% are owner-occupiers. Nearly half of the houses were built pre-1900 and only a quarter have been built since 1945. More than half the families in Youlgrave have lived in the village for over 30 years. Almost all the homes have a fridge, 80% have a washing machine and 66% have freezers. Samantha Bristow (11)
